sentences: Maa väed olid valmis kaitsema oma piire.
Sõjaväes teenivad paljud mehed ja naised.
context: The Estonian word 'väed' is the plural form of 'vägi', which means army, troops, or forces. It refers to organized military units or armed personnel when used in plural form. In Estonian, '-d' at the end of nouns typically indicates plural, so this would be equivalent to saying 'armies' or 'troops' in English.
